stimulusHtml: Which of the following best explains why this is true?

features.html:
Developmental psychologists cannot experiment on whether exposure to mercury1 during prenatal development causes delays in newborns’ physical milestones, such as crawling and walking. 

1: a toxic metal, found in some fish, which acts as a teratogen↩

choicesHtml: Administering known harmful substances for experimentation is unethical.
Finding mothers willing to ingest fish that might have mercury in them during pregnancy is difficult.
Studying the influence of any teratogen is always avoided by developmental psychologists.
Too many outside variables exist for an experiment to be conducted on this topic.
